question: I'm 40 years old a 30-year type-1 diabetic (never smoked).  One of my complications is autonomic neuropathy.  I've been told that this may be causing damage to my vagus nerve, which has increased my resting heart rate to 90-100.  Should I be concerned about this particular complication with regard to heart disease?  And seek further advice from a cardio specialist?
title: vagus nerve and diabetes
